item.title: StoryMapJS - Knight Lab Projects
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description: "StoryMapJS helps journalists craft intriguing narratives in which location is a key component of the story."

item.title: A Few Comments on the UN Broadband Commission's "Cyber Violence Against Women And Girls" Report | Popehat
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description: "I don't trust the UN on free speech issues. You shouldn't either. In a world where Iran wins a seat on the UN's Commission on the Status of Women, people who care about women's rights should also be skeptical. Pro-censorship forces continually pressure the UN for international laws and norms restricting speech — for instance by demanding laws outlawing blasphemy.Allow me some unabashed American exceptionalism: that's a bad thing. The United States' vigorous approach to protecting free speech and rejecting blasphemy laws is good, and foreign norms that encourage blasphemy laws often used to persecute religious and ethnicminorities are bad."

item.title: The fall of hacker-troll Andrew 'weev' Auernheimer
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description:
Andrew "weev" Auernheimer, the 29-year-old American hacker who became something of a folk hero by beating a controversial hacking conviction, wants you to know that he is incontrovertibly racist.

In a screed posted Thursday to the white supremacist site the Daily Stormer, Auernheimer rants about his treatment under the law, blaming his African-American judge and, more generally, "the Jews," whom he says built "an empire of wickedness the likes the world has never seen."

item.title: Instant Access To More Than 65 Applications | twoub.io
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description:
Intersting cloud hosting service.

Our service is billed hourly. Per gigabyte disk usage it's only 0.001 euro plus 0.001 euro per 32 MB RAM while your container is active. Only the disk usage that is going beyond the initial installation is billed. Traffic is included on a fair use base.

item.title: "Facebook has long been keen for more journalists to use their personal accounts like they do Twitter – to engage with followers, discuss their articles
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description:
"Facebook has long been keen for more journalists to use their personal accounts like they do Twitter – to engage with followers, discuss their articles and hunt for information. The company hasn’t had much success on this front to date, but that may be starting to change. It’s built a ‘parallel universe’ for journalists to use with their personal accounts, and it’s just like Twitter."

http://thenextweb.com/facebook/2015/09/27/facebook-has-built-a-parallel-universe-for-journalists-and-its-just-like-twitter/

item.title: Food production per capita over time
item.author: Theo Jones

item.title: "John Boehner Helped Start The Planned Parenthood Fight. It Just Ended His Career"
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description:
http://www.forbes.com/sites/dandiamond/2015/09/25/planned-parenthood-fight-costs-john-boehner-his-job/

It looks like the government will stay open, but John Boehner’s political career has come to an end.

Boehner on Friday morning announced that he will retire from Congress at the end of October, a decision that stunned Capitol Hill. The Speaker of the House had been pushed into a difficult choice:

  • Attempt to defund Planned Parenthood, which would satisfy rank-and-file Republicans but shut down the government; or
  • Find a short-term compromise with Democrats to keep the government open and revisit the Planned Parenthood funding issue down the road, which would anger House GOP members and lead to open challenges for his job.

item.title: [mac] QUESTION: Are files in Evernote also stored locally at the original file size? - Mac Help - Evernote User Forum
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description: Yes, all files in the Evernote Mac client are on your computer's hard drive. If you don't use the Mac client at all and just stick to the Web client, your notes and files will exist solely in the cloud. If you're concerned about disk space, that's certainly an option. Personally, I don't like the idea of having all my data in one place without a backup.

item.title: How To Use Evernote: The Unofficial Manual
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description:
Why do you want to use Evernote? Do you really know how to use Evernote? There’s a lot I could say, but to begin I’ll say one thing: I willingly opened up my wallet to pay for a premium subscription to Evernote. I can count on one hand how many services have compelled me to do that.

I see so many advantages to Evernote and we will explore some of them in depth later. But basically it all comes down to this: we are all becoming digital packrats.

As information becomes more plentiful, we are bombarded with relentless forms of media 24/7, such as blog posts, videos and photos. Our computer hard drives are also getting bigger and bigger (500GB hard drives are not uncommon). This means we have a huge amount of media material on our computers and no practical way in which to organize it all. How do you find that article that you saved to your computer last month about the new Batman movie? Or you need to lay your hands right away on a photo taken at your grandmother’s 90th birthday party. In all the mess and clutter that makes up your hard drive, finding a particular file could be a very laborious and time consuming task.
